All Classes

Class Description
Cavalry
Cavalry unit stats.
City
Class which represents a City object and all of its internal components such as producion, population, etc.
Civ
A launcher for our RPG.
CivBoard
Holds the collection of individual tiles that make up a single Civ map.
CivBoardTest  
CivController
Provides methods to calculate data about game state or act as a computer player that updates game state.
CivControllerTest
Tests the methods of CivController.
CivModel
Holds game state data and provides utility methods to query or update it.
CivModelTest
Tests the methods of CivModel.
CivView
A GUI, eventually.
Horses
Horses resource which unlocks cavalry
Iron
Iron resource which unlocks swordsmen
Militia
Class containing unit stats for the militia unit.
Player
Player class exists to keep an aggregation of data associated with each player so the controller knows what Units/Tiles each player is allowed to interact with.
Resource
Resource superclass - unlocks new units when a city owns a tile containing one of these.
Scout
Basic setup for a scout unit which has higher movement and sight.
Settler
Basic setup for a settler unit, which can only move and found cities.
Swordsman
Subclass containing stats for the swordsman unit.
Tile
Class representing a single tile within our board.
Tile.terrainTypes  
Unit
Unit superclass containing costs and fields to be filled by subclasses.
Warrior
Subclass containing stats for the warrior unit.
Wheat
Wheat resource subclass to unlock the militia unit.
